intro: Epilobium aequinoctiale, commonly known as the autumnal willow herb, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm, featuring slender stems that are often reddish in color. The plant produces showy pink to purple flowers in clusters, which bloom from late summer into early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its roots are fibrous and somewhat woody. Epilobium aequinoctiale thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wet meadows, riverbanks, and woodland edges.
